verbs.description: undig (third-person singular simple present undigs, present participle undigging, simple past and past participle undug)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To undo the process of digging; to fill up (a hole or grave) or bury again (something unearthed).
examples: Tom Cordery dead! the words seem almost a contradiction. One is tempted to send for the sexton and the undertaker, to undig the grave, to force open the coffin-lid — there must he some mistake.
